chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Nero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Nicholas J Nero appeared by video means with Attorney Vicki Zick. Prosecuting Atty Andrew John Maki appeared for State of Wisconsin.  A. Standaert - Clerk
State - we are here on a motion for resentence - Court of Appeals stated that sentencing factors were not stated
Atty Zick - deft is not objecting to sentence, but does not want to waive
State - believes sentence given by Judge Smeltzer was appropriate, makes argument - deft was given credit for time served, Ct1 - 1 year IC with credit for time served, $453 costs - Ct 2 - $1799 fine, 60 days jail, 24 mo rev DL, AODA and DSP, IID, ct 3 - 6 months jail, $443
Atty Zick - agrees with prosecutor, sentence was fair - Court needs to speak to gravity of offenses and the need to protect the public
Deft - not challenging sentence, believes it was fair

Court - reads charges and max penalties - speaks to gravity of offenses and the need to protect the public
Ct 1 - 1 year jail with credit for 1 year, $443 costs + $10 drug offender diversn sur
Ct 2 - $1799 fine, 60 days jail with credit for the time served, 24 month DL rev, AODA and DSP, IID
Ct 3 - 6 months jail with credit for time served, $443 costs
